</input>

</task>

<objects>

1: Sofa
</objects>

<answer-candidates>
0. Rightward Rotation - The camera rotates rightward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
1. Leftward Rotation - The camera rotates leftward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
</answer-candidates>

<output-format>
Please output your reasoning in <rsn></rsn> XML tags first, and then output the index of the answer-candidate you choose in <ans></ans> XML tags. Do not output any other text.
</output-format>
answer: <rsn>The sofa appears to move slightly to the right in the target viewpoint compared to the source viewpoint, indicating a leftward rotation of the camera.</rsn><ans>1</ans>
rsn: The sofa appears to move slightly to the right in the target viewpoint compared to the source viewpoint, indicating a leftward rotation of the camera.

You are given two images. The first image is the source viewpoint, and the second image is the target viewpoint. From source viewpoint to target viewpoint, the camera is moving around, i.e., with translation and rotation.
</input>

<task>
Your task is to infer the camera motion from the source viewpoint to the target viewpoint. You are given some answer candidates, and you need to select the most appropriate one in describing the camera motion in translation or rotation.
</task>

<objects>
Please compare the position of following objects in the source viewpoint and target viewpoint. They can be the reference objects to help you understand the camera motion.
1: White Fridge
</objects>

<hint>
1: The White Fridge is in a front-view in the source viewpoint and a right-view in the target viewpoint.
</hint>

<answer-candidates>
0. Rightward Translation - The camera translates rightward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
1. Leftward Translation - The camera translates leftward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
</answer-candidates>

<output-format>
Please output your reasoning in <rsn></rsn> XML tags first, and then output the index of the answer-candidate you choose in <ans></ans> XML tags. Do not output any other text.
</output-format>
answer: <rsn>The White Fridge is viewed from the front in the source image and from the right side in the target image. This indicates that the camera has moved to the right, allowing the right side of the fridge to become visible.</rsn><ans>0</ans>
rsn: The White Fridge is viewed from the front in the source image and from the right side in the target image. This indicates that the camera has moved to the right, allowing the right side of the fridge to become visible.

You are given two images. The first image is the source viewpoint, and the second image is the target viewpoint. From source viewpoint to target viewpoint, the camera is moving around, i.e., with translation and rotation.
</input>

<task>
Your task is to infer the camera motion from the source viewpoint to the target viewpoint. You are given some answer candidates, and you need to select the most appropriate one in describing the camera motion in translation or rotation.
</task>

<objects>
Please compare the position of following objects in the source viewpoint and target viewpoint. They can be the reference objects to help you understand the camera motion.
1: Central Middle Drawer
</objects>

<hint>
1: The Central Middle Drawer is in a left-view in the source viewpoint and a right-view in the target viewpoint.
</hint>

<thinking>
The camera-perspective and object-perspective are inverse, causing the camera movement to appear reversed relative to the object's movement.
</thinking>

<answer-candidates>
0. Leftward Rotation - The camera rotates leftward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
1. Rightward Rotation - The camera rotates rightward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
</answer-candidates>

<output-format>
Please output your reasoning in <rsn></rsn> XML tags first, and then output the index of the answer-candidate you choose in <ans></ans> XML tags. Do not output any other text.
</output-format>
answer: <rsn>The Central Middle Drawer appears to move from a left-view in the source image to a right-view in the target image. This indicates that the camera is rotating rightward to achieve this perspective change.</rsn><ans>1</ans>
rsn: The Central Middle Drawer appears to move from a left-view in the source image to a right-view in the target image. This indicates that the camera is rotating rightward to achieve this perspective change.

You are given two images. The first image is the source viewpoint, and the second image is the target viewpoint. From source viewpoint to target viewpoint, the camera is moving around, i.e., with translation and rotation.
</input>

<task>
Your task is to infer the camera motion from the source viewpoint to the target viewpoint. You are given some answer candidates, and you need to select the most appropriate one in describing the camera motion in translation or rotation.
</task>

<objects>
Please compare the position of following objects in the source viewpoint and target viewpoint. They can be the reference objects to help you understand the camera motion.
1: White Fridge
</objects>

<hint>
1: The White Fridge is in a front-view in the source viewpoint and a left-view in the target viewpoint.
</hint>

<thinking>
The camera-perspective and object-perspective are inverse, causing the camera movement to appear reversed relative to the object's movement.
</thinking>

<answer-candidates>
0. Rightward Translation - The camera translates rightward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
1. Leftward Translation - The camera translates leftward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
</answer-candidates>

<output-format>
Please output your reasoning in <rsn></rsn> XML tags first, and then output the index of the answer-candidate you choose in <ans></ans> XML tags. Do not output any other text.
</output-format>
answer: <rsn>In the source viewpoint, the White Fridge is seen from the front. In the target viewpoint, it is seen from the left side. This indicates that the camera has moved to the right, causing the perspective to shift from a front view to a left view of the fridge.</rsn><ans>0</ans>
rsn: In the source viewpoint, the White Fridge is seen from the front. In the target viewpoint, it is seen from the left side. This indicates that the camera has moved to the right, causing the perspective to shift from a front view to a left view of the fridge.
